title: Race Condition in account survey

profile.name: Slack
profile.about: All your team communication in one place, instantly searchable, and available wherever you go.

vulnerability_information:
There exists a race condition in the beginning survey, allowing a user to get $100 in credit multiple times. In my example, I made 2 asynchronous requests, and was credited with $200.

POC:

1. Create a new slack team.
2. Set your password, and find the account creation survey.
3. Complete the survey, and intercept the request using a proxy such as BurpSuite.
4. Repeat the request asynchronously, such as in the command line by executing `(command) & (command)`.
5. The survey will be credited to your account multiple times. See the attached screenshot.

Please let me know if you need any more information.
vulnerability_information_html:
There exists a race condition in the beginning survey, allowing a user to get $100 in credit multiple times. In my example, I made 2 asynchronous requests, and was credited with $200.

POC:

  1. Create a new slack team.
  2. Set your password, and find the account creation survey.
  3. Complete the survey, and intercept the request using a proxy such as BurpSuite.
  4. Repeat the request asynchronously, such as in the command line by executing (command) & (command).
  5. The survey will be credited to your account multiple times. See the attached screenshot.

Please let me know if you need any more information.

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

Can you be a bit more specific about what request you are issuing and additionally where it is located in the UI?  I created a team as in your reproduction steps, but didn't see a link to a survey.  Can you clarify what specific commands are you performing so that we may replicate your results?

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report.

Can you be a bit more specific about what request you are issuing and additionally where it is located in the UI? I created a team as in your reproduction steps, but didn't see a link to a survey. Can you clarify what specific commands are you performing so that we may replicate your results?

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Ok, *finally* found where the survey is offered :) It's after you set your password, which might only sometimes happen, which would explain why you hadn't seen it (and neither had I when I tried just now), but the URL still works: https://yourteam.slack.com/account/reset/complete.

More detailed POC:

1. Visit https://yourteam.slack.com/account/reset/complete, which gives you the option to take the survey.
2. Complete the server, and intercept the request to complete. It should look sort of like this:

```
POST /survey/6-23387113491-bed6344a95 HTTP/1.1
Host: slack.com
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Origin: https://slack.com
Cookie: ...
Connection: close
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_11_4) AppleWebKit/601.5.17 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/9.1 Safari/601.5.17
Accept-Language: en-us
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Content-Length: 407

done2=1&crumb=s-1473199596-f5b4521138-%E2%98%83&referral_options%5B%5D=Airport&referral_options%5B%5D=Radio&referral_options_other=&interest_options%5B%5D=Works+seamlessly+across+all+devices&interest_options%5B%5D=Improve+productivity&interest_options_other=&software_options%5B%5D=Google+Hangouts%2FChat&software_options%5B%5D=Yammer&software_options_other=&company_size=1-9&company_industry=Consumer+Goods
```

3. Repeat the request multiple times, such as in the command line. In BurpSuite or Chrome developer tools, copy the request as a curl command, and execute:

`(command) & (command) & (command)`

I found that sending 3-4 requests increases the likelihood that multiple will be accepted.

After this, I had 2 survey completions in my account, both for $100.

Hope this helps!

summaries.content: @cablej found a race condition in our account creation survey, which allowed a user to receive extra Slack credits. We investigated and fixed the issue. Thanks for the report @cablej!
summaries.content_html: @cablej found a race condition in our account creation survey, which allowed a user to receive extra Slack credits. We investigated and fixed the issue. Thanks for the report @cablej!
